sec.p: We observed an increase in body mass daily from morning to afternoon in 27 individuals that were weighed twice in the same day ( Fig. 1). The average increase was 0.205 ± 0.117 g/h, with no significant differences between the three social classes ( F 2,24 = 2.035, p = 0.15). The mass increase during the examined central hours of the day was best explained by a linear increase ( t = 1.691, P < 0.05), while the addition of a quadratic term was not significant ( t = 0.354, P = 0.35).

div.div: Mass change of Florida Scrub-Jays within a day. Circles represent female breeders; diamonds, male breeders; squares, helpers.
